verses.verse: "You are the sons<WH1121> of the Lord<WH3068> your God;<WH430> you shall not cut<WH1413> yourselves nor<WH3808> shave<WH7760> <WH7144> your forehead<WH996> <WH5869> for the sake of the dead.<WH4191>

"For you are a holy<WH6918> people<WH5971> to the Lord<WH3068> your God;<WH430> and the Lord<WH3068> has chosen<WH977> you to be a people<WH5971> for His own possession<WH5459> out of all<WH3605> the peoples<WH5971> who<WH834> are on the face<WH6440> of the earth.<WH127>
"You shall not eat<WH398> any<WH3605> detestable<WH8441> thing.<WH8441>
"These<WH2088> are the animals<WH929> which<WH834> you may eat:<WH398> the ox,<WH7794> the sheep,<WH3775> <WH7716> the goat,<WH5795>
the deer,<WH354> the gazelle,<WH6643> the roebuck,<WH3180> the wild<WH689> goat,<WH689> the ibex,<WH1788> the antelope<WH8377> and the mountain<WH2169> sheep.<WH2169>

"And any<WH3605> animal<WH929> that divides<WH6536> the hoof<WH6541> and has<WH8156> the hoof<WH8157> split<WH8156> in two<WH8147> [and] chews<WH5927> the cud,<WH1625> among the animals,<WH929> that you may eat.<WH398>

"Nevertheless,<WH389> you are not to eat<WH398> of these<WH2088> among<WH4480> those which chew<WH5927> the cud,<WH1625> or among<WH4480> those that divide<WH6536> the hoof<WH6541> in two:<WH8156> the camel<WH1581> and the rabbit<WH768> and the rock-badger, for though they chew<WH5927> the cud,<WH1625> they do not divide<WH6536> the hoof;<WH6541> they are unclean<WH2931> for you.

"And the pig,<WH2386> because<WH3588> it divides<WH6536> the hoof<WH6541> but [does] not [chew] the cud,<WH1625> it is unclean<WH2931> for you. You shall not eat<WH398> any<WH4480> of their flesh<WH1320> nor<WH3808> touch<WH5060> their carcasses.<WH5038>
"These<WH2088> you may eat<WH398> of all<WH3605> that are in water:<WH4325> anything<WH3605> that has fins<WH5579> and scales<WH7193> you may eat,<WH398>
but anything<WH3605> that does not have<WH369> fins<WH5579> and scales<WH7193> you shall not eat;<WH398> it is unclean<WH2931> for you.
"You may eat<WH398> any<WH3605> clean<WH2889> bird.<WH6833>
"But these<WH2088> are the ones which<WH834> you shall not eat:<WH398> the eagle<WH5404> and the vulture<WH6538> and the buzzard,<WH5822>
and the red kite,<WH1676> the falcon,<WH344> and the kite<WH1676> in their kinds,<WH4327>
and every<WH3605> raven<WH6158> in its kind,<WH4327>
and the ostrich,<WH3284> the owl,<WH8464> the sea<WH7828> gull,<WH7828> and the hawk<WH5322> in their kinds,<WH4327>
the little<WH9205> owl,<WH9205> the great<WH3244> owl,<WH3244> the white<WH8580> owl,<WH8580>
the pelican,<WH6893> the carrion<WH7360> vulture,<WH7360> the cormorant,<WH7994>
the stork,<WH2624> and the heron<WH601> in their kinds,<WH4327> and the hoopoe<WH1744> and the bat.<WH5847>
"And all<WH3605> the teeming<WH8318> life<WH8318> with wings<WH5775> are unclean<WH2931> to you; they shall not be eaten.<WH398>
"You may eat<WH398> any<WH3605> clean<WH2889> bird.<WH5775>

"You shall not eat<WH398> anything<WH3605> which<WH5038> dies<WH5038> [of itself.] You may give<WH5414> it to the alien<WH1616> who<WH834> is in your town,<WH8179> so that he may eat<WH398> it, or<WH176> you may sell<WH4376> it to a foreigner,<WH5237> for you are a holy<WH6918> people<WH5971> to the Lord<WH3068> your God.<WH430> You shall not boil<WH1310> a kid<WH1423> in its mother's milk.<WH2461>
"You shall surely<WH6237> tithe<WH6237> all<WH3605> the produce<WH8393> from what<WH2233> you sow,<WH2233> which comes<WH3318> out of the field<WH7704> every<WH8141> year.<WH8141>

"And you shall eat<WH398> in the presence<WH6440> of the Lord<WH3068> your God,<WH430> at the place<WH4725> where<WH834> <WH8033> He chooses<WH977> to establish<WH7931> His name,<WH8034> the tithe<WH4643> of your grain,<WH1715> your new<WH8492> wine,<WH8492> your oil,<WH3323> and the first-born of your herd<WH1241> and your flock,<WH6629> in order<WH4616> that you may learn<WH3925> to fear<WH3372> the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> always.<WH3605> <WH3117>

"And if<WH3588> the distance<WH1870> is so great<WH7235> for you that you are not able<WH3201> to bring<WH5375> [the tithe,] since<WH3588> the place<WH4725> where<WH834> <WH8033> the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> chooses<WH977> to set<WH7760> His name<WH8034> is too far<WH7368> away from you when<WH3588> the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> blesses<WH1288> you,

then you shall exchange<WH5414> [it] for money,<WH3701> and bind<WH6696> the money<WH3701> in your hand<WH3027> and go<WH1980> to the place<WH4725> which<WH834> the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> chooses.<WH977>

"And you may spend<WH5414> the money<WH3701> for whatever<WH3605> <WH834> your heart<WH5315> desires,<WH183> for oxen,<WH1241> or sheep,<WH6629> or wine,<WH3196> or strong<WH7941> drink,<WH7941> or whatever<WH3605> <WH834> your heart<WH5315> desires;<WH7592> and there<WH8033> you shall eat<WH398> in the presence<WH6440> of the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> and rejoice,<WH8055> you and your household.<WH1004>
"Also you shall not neglect<WH5800> the Levite<WH3881> who<WH834> is in your town,<WH8179> for he has<WH369> no<WH369> portion<WH2506> or inheritance<WH5159> among<WH5973> you.

"At the end<WH7097> of every third<WH7969> year<WH8141> you shall bring<WH3318> out all<WH3605> the tithe<WH4643> of your produce<WH8393> in that year,<WH8141> and shall deposit<WH5117> [it] in your town.<WH8179>

"And the Levite,<WH3881> because<WH3588> he has<WH369> no<WH369> portion<WH2506> or inheritance<WH5159> among<WH5973> you, and the alien,<WH1616> the orphan<WH3490> and the widow<WH490> who<WH834> are in your town,<WH8179> shall come<WH935> and eat<WH398> and be satisfied,<WH7646> in order<WH4616> that the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> may bless<WH1288> you in all<WH3605> the work<WH4639> of your hand<WH3027> which<WH834> you do.<WH6213>
